abstract: Apple, in rare disappointment, misses Wall Street forecasts but still reports a 54 percent increase in profit and a 39 percent jump in revenue for its fourth-quarter results; company blames lackluster iPhone sales due to widespread rumors that a new phone would be released; profit was $6.62 billion, or $7.05 a share, on revenue of $28.27 billion.
snippet: The company said iPhone sales fell in the quarter because of widespread rumors that a new phone would be released, delaying consumer purchases.
lead_paragraph: The company said iPhone sales fell in the quarter because of widespread rumors that a new phone would be released, delaying consumer purchases.

headline.main: Apple’s Profit Gains 54%, but iPhone Sales Fall Short of Expectations
headline.print_headline: Apple’s Profit Gains 54%, but iPhone Sales Fall Short of Expectations
headline.seo: Apple Disappoints Despite 54% Rise in Profit
